programme.title: HealthDay
programme.sub-title: Which Diet Trends are Most Effective?
programme.desc: In this episode, we’ll be breaking down several popular diets and eating routines and looking at the different effects they can have on your body.

programme.title: HealthDay

programme.title: HealthDay
programme.desc: In this episode, we’ll talk with health experts about the importance of sleep, sharing different techniques and tips that can improve your sleep schedule and help you to wake up each morning feeling rested and refreshed.

programme.title: HealthDay
programme.desc: In this episode, we’ll talk with a group of nurses about their experiences dealing with increased workplace violence and harassment during the COVID-19 pandemic. We’ll also go over the effects of COVID-19 and irregular sleep patterns on depression in children and adults.

programme.title: HealthDay
programme.desc: In this episode, we’ll talk with the chair of last year’s American Heart Association Scientific Sessions on new diet guidelines and programs to combat health inequity. We’ll also share tips on improving your heart health and identifying potential symptoms of heart damage and disease.

programme.title: Dr. Q&A
programme.desc: Stomach aches and pains are a common complaint. Here are the signs that the problem could be serious.

programme.title: Dr. Q&A
programme.desc: Back pain is one of the most common conditions today but there are treatments, exercises, and therapies that can relieve the pain that don’t involve either narcotics or surgery. But if those interventions are needed you want to make sure you have what you need to make an informed decision

programme.title: Dr. Q&A
programme.sub-title: Dr. Q&A - Alzheimer's Disease: Hope For The Future
programme.desc: Alzheimer’s disease affects millions of people around the world, robbing them of their memory and of so much of their lives. There is still no sure but there are some treatments and active clinical trials that are offering promise. In this program, we discuss some of the lifestyle changes people can make to help prevent or at least slow down the progression of Alzheimer’s and stay as mentally healthy as possible.

programme.title: Dr. Q&A
programme.sub-title: Dr. Q&A - A Plastic Surgeon Answers Your Questions
programme.desc: Think you need a little nip or tuck? Want answers about fillers or Botox? Need advice about hair loss ? Our expert talks about all that and much more. Plus he highlights a new procedure that can help people who have had suffered traumatic injuries to their limbs.

programme.title: Dr. Q&A
programme.sub-title: Dr. Q&A - The Truth About Prostate Cancer
programme.desc: Prostate cancer is the most common cancer in men. But there is a great deal of misinformation about treatments, causes and even screening. Find out the truth from the expert in this program.

programme.title: OmStars- Yoga Is Series

programme.title: OmStars- Yoga Is Series
programme.desc: Today's lesson is on Spirit and how to tune into that space beyond the physical.

programme.title: Good Morning Joy
programme.desc: Celebrity hypnotist Tim Shurr helps you unlock happiness and shed anxiety. Shari tests her hypnotizability, and the story of a woman who took back her mental health by empowering women worldwide. Plus, live from Heartfulness headquarters in India.

programme.title: Good Morning Joy
programme.sub-title: Good Morning Joy - Triumph Over Trauma
programme.desc: 1963 Playboy Icon and Cosby Survivor, Victoria Valentino, shares her journey of overcoming unimaginable circumstances leading her to activism and purpose. Plus, one man's heroic efforts to save a tiny, unconscious life, and fun street interviews from NYC.

programme.title: The Aware Show
programme.sub-title: The Aware Show: Judy Wilkins-Smith - Decoding Your Hidden Ancestral Patterns
programme.desc: Host Lisa Garr interviews Judy Wilkins-Smith, a highly regarded systemic executive coach, trainer, facilitator, and Family Constellations expert. She shares her knowledge of neuroscience, epigenetics, and genealogy and talks about how families can end limiting cycles and reframe challenges into lasting breakthroughs and peak performance. Her book is Decoding Your Emotional Blueprint: A Powerful Guide to Transformation Through Disentangling Multigenerational Patterns.

programme.title: The Aware Show
programme.sub-title: The Aware Show: Dr Sue Morter and Anat Baniel – How to Rid Stress from Your Body
programme.desc: Host Lisa Garr interviews Dr Sue Morter and Anat Baniel who are experts in energy methods which help us to live abundantly healthy lives. International speaker and Master of Bio-Energetic Theory, Dr. Sue Morter utilizes the embodiment of high-frequency energy patterns to activate full human potential. Anat Baniel, founder of Anat Baniel Method NeuroMovement, has developed a method, supported by brain science, that powerfully taps into our brain’s enormous potential for change and learning.

programme.title: The Aware Show
programme.sub-title: The Aware Show: Jim Blake – The Zen Executive
programme.desc: Host Lisa Garr interviews Jim Blake, best-selling author of The Zen Executive. Known for his wise and compassionate leadership skills, Jim has held numerous executive positions in the corporate world, and is currently the CEO of Unity World Headquarters. He shares experiences of bosses who led by fear and how he gleaned that there must be a better way. He developed a leadership style of cooperation, rather than competition. He discusses the importance of employees feeling seen and heard and offers suggestions for building strong teams and relationships.

programme.title: The Aware Show
programme.sub-title: The Aware Show: Machiel Klerk - Your Dreams
programme.desc: Host Lisa Garr interviews Machiel Klerk, licensed mental health therapist and dream expert. He is the author of Dream Guidance – Connecting to the Soul Through Dream Incubation. He discusses five steps to easily build and nurture a relationship with your dreams through the conscious effort of dream incubation. He has travelled the world and studied many cultures and their healing traditions, specifically their dream technologies.

programme.title: Expiration Date
programme.desc: Charlie Silvercould III carries around a family curse passed down from his grandfather; death by a milk truck on his 25th birthday. With eight days left, Charlie accepts his fate and starts taking care of his unfinished business, until he meets a girl who won't let him die in peace.

programme.title: Get Your Yoga On
programme.desc: Dive into the fundamentals of yoga with this sequence that builds up to downward facing dog.
